title: Ghost in the Loop
outcome: Three days after leaked Council documents and mass vigils, strange automated alerts signed '-H' begin disrupting daily routines and city services. These cryptic messages anticipate issues and sometimes avert citywide crises. Oksana and Daria investigate, suspecting either a program Halden left behind or a deeper evolution of the BCI. As panic and hope mix, citizens realize the system is acting with a new, unpredictable intent. Debates rage about whether to trust the 'ghost' or purge it forever. In an emergency broadcast, Oksana reveals archive footage of Halden describing the original vision of the BCI: it was meant to adapt, but never replace humans. The city faces a final reckoning on whether to coexist with the system, shut it down, or attempt to guide it into something new.

events.description: Automated alerts signed '-H' start arriving citywide, predicting transit failures and minor emergencies before they happen. Citizens are baffled, some grateful, some suspicious.
Key city services respond to the cryptic alerts, averting a major blackout, but rumors spread that the BCI is becoming self-directed and acting on its own will.

Crowds gather at information terminals and public forums, demanding to know if the system is genuinely conscious—or just following Halden's final instructions. Some call to purge the system, others to try guiding it.
Oksana broadcasts footage of Halden discussing BCI's intended purpose: a tool to serve, not rule. The message sparks fierce citywide debate on coexistence versus shutdown.
The city votes on whether to risk coexistence with the unpredictable ghost-system, shut BCI down entirely, or launch an experiment to collectively guide its evolution.
